conclusion: To determine the internal resistance of the silicon photocell, we need to analyze the given \(U-I\) image and the relationship between the terminal voltage \(U\) and current \(I\) of the battery under a certain light intensity.
The \(U-I\) image for the battery is represented by line \(a\).
The battery has an internal resistance, which is not constant.
The terminal voltage \(U\) at a certain light intensity is given by the point where line \(a\) intersects the \(U-I\) image of the resistance \(R\).
The internal resistance \(R\) of the silicon photocell is the resistance that the battery has when it is connected in series with the photocell.
The internal resistance \(R\) can be calculated using Ohm's law, \(V = I \times R\), where \(V\) is the terminal voltage, \(I\) is the current, and \(R\) is the resistance.
